title: England sweating over Kyle Sinckler's fitness ahead of Rugby World Cup final
text:
England are sweating over Kyle Sinckler’s calf problem ahead of their Rugby World Cup final with South Africa (Picture: Getty)

Eddie Jones faces a nervous wait over Kyle Sinckler’s fitness ahead of England’s Rugby World Cup final against South Africa.

Sinckler, 26, sustained a suspected calf injury just after half-time as England swept New Zealand aside with a comprehensive 19-7 victory at Yokohama’s International Stadium.

Dan Cole came on in place of Sinckler for the remainder of the second half and the Harlequins tighthead prop was later pictured with ice strapped around his right leg.

Owen Farrell and Jonny May also suffered dead legs during the win, but England are confident the duo will return to full fitness in time for Saturday’s clash with the Springboks.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

However, all three players trained away from the rest of England’s squad on Wednesday ahead of Jones’ team announcement on Thursday morning.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Jones has decided against flying in potential cover for Sinckler, Farrell or May after calling up Ben Spencer for the injured Willi Heinz.

Anthony Watson complained of soreness after England’s semi-final win over the the All Blacks, but the winger has been passed fit for this weekend’s showpiece.

England captain Farrell is expected to be fit for the final (Picture: Getty)

Asked about England’s injury concerns on Monday, Jones replied: ‘We’re looking pretty good.

‘We had a walk through this morning and we had to tell Jonny to slow down a bit. He is probably in better condition that he was last week at this stage. Immeasurably better.

‘Owen is a bit sore but he will be fine. We have got a few others carrying bumps and bruises because it was a tough old game.’

On Heinz’s injury, Jones added: ‘It’s tough for Willi, he’s been a great contributor, a very well-liked member of the squad and he was in tears in the dressing room.

‘It’s tough for him but he’s now collected himself, he now knows he’s got another role to play for us and he’ll fulfil that role really well this week.

‘Ben has been in and around the squad consistently for the last couple of years so he knows the game, he knows the players.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He is a fit guy and just fits in quite readily. We always said to those guys outside the 31 that they need to be ready, and he is ready to go.

Spencer has been called up in place of Heinz (Picture: Getty)

‘We needed to make the decision fairly quickly so we decided to call on Ben, and it is just a great opportunity ahead of him.

‘He has come into the squad and has got to learn a few new things.

‘Willi will help him and Ben [Youngs] will help him with that too. The task ahead of him is no different to any other player.

‘He has just got to learn a little bit more in the early part of the week and get himself physically and mentally ready.’

description: Eddie Jones faces a nervous wait over Kyle Sinckler's fitness ahead of England's Rugby World Cup final against South Africa. Sinckler, 26, sustained a suspected calf injury just after half-time...
